title: Applying a Hygge-Socio-Pedagogical Approach to Design Hybrid Learning Environments in Healthcare Education

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers, requiring hybrid instructional design integrating social, emotional, and cognitive elements in smartphone-based learning environments

learning_goals: Learners can design healthcare scenario-based microlearning content by applying the Hybrid-ACAD model in mobile environments.
Learners successfully perform ≥80% of patient consultation simulation activities linking physical and virtual learning spaces based on the huthagosophical approach.
Learners execute healthcare decision-making processes ≥3 times using team-based learning (TBL) tools even in resource-constrained technological environments.

resources: Reflective Journaling Tool with Voice Recording Functionality
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
